meanings.definition: To raise or lift something heavy using ropes or machinery.
meanings.sent1: The workers had to hoist the crate onto the truck.
meanings.sent2: They hoist the flag every morning at the school.
meanings.sent3: Trying to hoist a piano by yourself would be quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: She hoisted her spirits by listening to uplifting music.
meanings.sent5: The superhero effortlessly hoisted the car above his head.

meanings.definition: A device used for lifting heavy objects.
meanings.sent1: The crane had a powerful hoist to lift the steel beams.
meanings.sent2: The hoist in the garage helped raise the engine out of the car.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended his toy truck was a hoist for his action figures.
meanings.sent4: The hoist in the factory worked tirelessly, lifting boxes all day.
meanings.sent5: The shipyard installed a new hoist to improve efficiency.

meanings.definition: The act of lifting something heavy.
meanings.sent1: The hoist of the heavy box strained his muscles.
meanings.sent2: The hoist of the weights at the gym made him feel stronger.
meanings.sent3: The cat's attempt to hoist the large fish out of the bowl was comical.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a hoist, lifting everyone's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The hoist of the hot air balloon filled the sky with color.
